doc:
Walter Cartier https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Cartier 0 Walter Cartier (March 29, 1922 – August 17, 1995) was a professional boxer turned actor, originally from the Bronx in New York City, New York. He became a professional boxer after World War II. Film director Stanley Kubrick's first film, Day of the Fight (1951), featured Cartier and his twin brother, Vincent. After this, Walter Cartier tried his hand at acting in other films such as Somebody Up There Likes Me (1956) and television. Today, he is best known for his role in the classic United States sitcom The Phil Silvers Show, appearing as the mild-mannered Private Claude Dillingham. One memorable episode was written around Cartier and his boxing skills. Walter_Cartier ( March_29_,_1922 – August_17_,_1995 ) was a_professional_boxer turned actor , originally from the_Bronx in New_York_City , New_York . He became a_professional_boxer after World_War_II . Film_director_Stanley_Kubrick 's_first_film , Day of the_Fight_(_1951_) , featured Cartier and his_twin_brother , Vincent . After this , Walter_Cartier tried his_hand at acting in other_films such_as Somebody Up There Likes Me ( 1956_)_and_television . Today , he is_best_known for his_role in the_classic_United_States_sitcom The_Phil_Silvers_Show , appearing as the_mild-mannered_Private_Claude_Dillingham . One_memorable_episode was_written around Cartier and his_boxing_skills .
